info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS WITH REDUCED VISIBILITY IMPACTING PORTIONS OF EASTERN OHIO, SOUTHWEST PENNSYLVANIA, AND THE NORTHERN WEST VIRGINIA PANHANDLE... At 12:55 PM, radar indicated scattered to numerous snow showers moving in an east-southeast direction across much of eastern Ohio, southwest Pennsylvania, and northern West Virginia. These will continue to impact the area into the afternoon, reducing visibility to 1 mile or less. The heaviest snow showers may briefly reduce visibility to one- quarter mile, create a quick coating of slick snow on surfaces, and even produce brief small graupel. Brief wind gusts to 30 MPH are also possible. Any snow accumulation on roadways should melt shortly after a shower passes. Use caution if you encounter reduced visibility or slippery roads while driving. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling. Consider delaying travel until the heavier snow showers pass your location.
